verses.text: And the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto me, saying,
Son of man, set thy face toward Jerusalem, and drop \add thy word\add* toward the holy places, and prophesy against the land of Israel,

and say to the land of Israel, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Behold, I \add am\add* against thee, and will draw forth my sword out of his sheath, and will cut off from thee the righteous and the wicked.
Seeing then that I will cut off from thee the righteous and the wicked, therefore shall my sword go forth out of his sheath against all flesh from the south \add to\add* the north:
that all flesh may know that I the \sc Lord\sc* have drawn forth my sword out of his sheath: it shall not return any more.
Sigh therefore, thou son of man, with the breaking of \add thy\add* loins; and with bitterness sigh before their eyes.

And it shall be, when they say unto thee, Wherefore sighest thou? that thou shalt answer, For the tidings; because it cometh: and every heart shall melt, and all hands shall be feeble, and every spirit shall faint, and all knees shall be weak \add as\add* water: behold, it cometh, and shall be brought to pass, saith the Lord \sc God\sc*.
Again the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto me, saying,
Son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Say, A sword, a sword is sharpened, and also furbished:
it is sharpened to make a sore slaughter; \add it is\add* furbished that it may glitter: should we then make mirth? it contemneth the rod of my son, \add as\add* every tree.
And he hath given it to be furbished, that \add it\add* may be handled: this sword is sharpened, and it \add is\add* furbished, to give it into the hand of the slayer.

Cry and howl, son of man: for it shall be upon my people, it \add shall be\add* upon all the princes of Israel: terrors by reason of the sword shall be upon my people: smite therefore upon \add thy\add* thigh.
Because \add it is\add* a trial, and what if \add the sword\add* contemn even the rod? it shall be no \add more\add*, saith the Lord \sc God\sc*.

Thou therefore, son of man, prophesy, and smite \add thine\add* hands together, and let the sword be doubled the third time, the sword of the slain: it \add is\add* the sword of the great \add men that are\add* slain, which entereth into their privy chambers.

I have set the point of the sword against all their gates, that \add their\add* heart may faint, and \add their\add* ruins be multiplied: ah, \add it is\add* made bright, \add it is\add* wrapt up for the slaughter.
Go thee one way or other, \add either\add* on the right hand, \add or\add* on the left, whithersoever thy face \add is\add* set.
I will also smite mine hands together, and I will cause my fury to rest: I the \sc Lord\sc* have said \add it\add*.
The word of the \sc Lord\sc* came unto me again, saying,

Also, thou son of man, appoint thee two ways, that the sword of the king of Babylon may come: both twain shall come forth out of one land: and choose thou a place, choose \add it\add*, at the head of the way to the city.
Appoint a way, that the sword may come to Rabbath of the Ammonites, and to Judah in Jerusalem the defenced.
For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination: he made \add his\add* arrows bright, he consulted with images, he looked in the liver.

At his right hand was the divination for Jerusalem, to appoint captains, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice with shouting, to appoint \add battering\add* rams against the gates, to cast a mount, \add and\add* to build a fort.
And it shall be unto them as a false divination in their sight, to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembrance the iniquity, that \add they\add* may be taken.

Therefore thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*; Because ye have made your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are discovered, so that in all your doings your sins do appear; because, \add I say\add*, that ye are come to remembrance, ye shall be taken with the hand.
And thou, profane wicked prince of Israel, whose day is come, when iniquity \add shall have\add* an end,
thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*; Remove the diadem, and take off the crown: this \add shall\add* not \add be\add* the same: exalt \add him that is\add* low, and abase \add him that is\add* high.
I will overturn, overturn, overturn it: and it shall be no \add more\add*, until he come whose right it is; and I will give it \add him\add*.

And thou, son of man, prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc* concerning the Ammonites, and concerning their reproach; even say thou, The sword, the sword \add is\add* drawn: for the slaughter \add it is\add* furbished, to consume because of the glittering:

whiles \add they\add* see vanity unto thee, whiles \add they\add* divine a lie unto thee, to bring thee upon the necks of \add them that are\add* slain of the wicked, whose day is come, when \add their\add* iniquity \add shall have\add* an end.
Shall I cause \add it\add* to return into his sheath? I will judge thee in the place where thou wast created, in the land of thy nativity.
And I will pour out mine indignation upon thee, I will blow against thee in the fire of my wrath, and deliver thee into the hand of brutish men, \add and\add* skilful to destroy.
Thou shalt be for fuel to the fire; thy blood shall be in the midst of the land; thou shalt be no \add more\add* remembered: for I the \sc Lord\sc* have spoken \add it\add*.
